bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition brought about by wind. Su wen 素問 74: 諸風掉眩，皆屬於肝 , “ All [diseases with] wind [causing] swaying and dizziness, without exception they are associated with the liver”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Bai bing zhu zhi yao 百病主治藥 , “The Hundred Diseases and The Drugs Capable of Curing Them”; section Zhu feng 諸風 , All [diseases with] wind, lists zhong zang 中臟 , depots struck [by wind]; zhong fu 中腑 , palaces struck [by wind]; zhong jing 中經 , conduits struck [by wind]; zhong qi 中氣 , struck [by wind] qi, tan jue 痰厥 , phlegm recession; tong feng 痛風 , pain wind; po shang feng 破傷風 , 破傷風 , wound wind; ma bi 麻痹 , hemp[-like numbness] blockage. In addition, the Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 refers to many kinds of pathological conditions such as zhu feng xuan yun 諸風眩暈 , all [diseases with] wind [associated with] dizziness; zhu feng bu sui 諸風不遂， all [diseases with] wind [with body parts] failing to respond; zhu feng tong bi 諸風痛痹， all [diseases with] wind [associated with] blockage with pain; and zhu feng sao yang 諸風瘙癢， all [diseases with] wind [associated with] itching.
